intro: Cicerbita alpina, commonly known as the alpine celandine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. It produces small, greenish fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Cicerbita alpina is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
